intro: Alpinia pelecystyla, commonly known as the Siam sand ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Alpinia pelecystyla typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its rhizomes are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its ornamental value is also appreciated in horticulture.
